intro: Tupistra veratrifolia, commonly known as the common spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white to yellowish sap, which can be toxic if exposed to skin. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in the spring. It is native to various regions in Europe and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Tupistra veratrifolia is a hardy plant that thrives in full sun to partial shade conditions.
